did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.repository: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center.
did.abstract: Mary Wood Forman was born on 17 November 1918 in Mussoorie, India, where her parents served as Presbyterian missionaries. Her family moved in 1923 to Columbus, Ohio. Forman graduated from Ohio State University in 1940 and received a Masters degree in Social Work from Western Reserve University in 1944. After several years abroad and in New York City, Forman moved to Hartford, CT in 1956. It was here that she developed her interest in photography. She traveled to Europe and the American West, recording what she saw in the photographs she took. She also took two trips to India, resulting in a major show of her work in Hartford. She preferred to develop and print her images herself, in order to bring out her individual perspective. Forman lived in the Hartford area and worked in the Hartford schools until her death on 22 August 1989.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Mary Wood Forman was born on 17 November 1918 in Mussoorie, India, where her parents served as Presbyterian missionaries. Her family moved in 1923 to Columbus, Ohio. Forman graduated from Ohio State University in 1940 and received a Masters degree in Social Work from Western Reserve University in 1944. After several years abroad and in New York City, Forman moved to Hartford, CT, in 1956. It was here that she developed her interest in photography. A significant number of her images were published in the Hartford Courant. Her favorite photographic subjects in Hartford were the children of the city, although she was also interested in urban structures. She traveled to Europe and the American West, recording what she saw in the photographs she took. She also took two trips to India, resulting in a major show of her work in Hartford. She preferred to develop and print her images herself, in order to bring out her individual perspective.
Forman lived in the Hartford area and worked in the Hartford schools until her death on 22 August 1989.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains black and white and color images in addition to contact sheets and some negatives. A portion of the images have been mounted and some are signed.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Oversize images have been listed as appropriate.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of Photographs covering a wide spectrum of subjects. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This record series is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on this collection.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], Mary Wood Forman Photograph Collection. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Unknown. Possibly donated by her brother David Forman of New Haven after her death.
